This standard replaces GB 18030-1 2005 Information Technology "Chinese Character Encoding Character Set" compared with GB 18030-1 2005, in addition to structural adjustments and editorial changes, the main extension changes are as follows:
added the scope of application of this standard (see Chapter I).

In the four-byte encoding area, 18 GB13000 code positions were changed (see Appendix D, 2005 version of Appendix D);
deleted Appendix “Additional Chinese Characters and Radicals/Components” (see Appendix 0 in the 2005 version),
Added the level of implementation " (see section 9 drafts);
Added the data appendix "General Standard Chinese Characters Table; Code Positions of Proposals" see Appendix D.

Information Technology "Chinese Coding Character Set
1 This standard specifies the Unicode characters and their binary encoding in hexadecimal notation for use in information technology.
This standard is applicable to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other graphic characters of text information.

This standard is applicable to technical products that have the function of information processing and exchange of Chinese and other graphic character information, including but not limited to software products represented by input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text conversion, and handwriting recognition, as well as portable products represented by computers, communication terminal equipment, e-book readers, and learning machines.
2 normative reference documents
The contents of the following documents are referred to in this document as normative references and are indispensable to this document.
For dated references, only the edition dated as specified applies to this document; for undated references, the latest edition (including all amendments) applies to this document.
GB2312.1-1980 “Information Exchange Coding Character Set” Basic Set
GB11383-1989 Information processing - Information interchange - Coding structure and coding rules
GB13000 Information technology—Universal multiple-octet coded character set (UCS)
3. Terms and definitions
The following terms and definitions apply to this standard.
3.1 字符 character
an element of a set of elements used for organization, control, or representation of data.
3.2 Coded character
An example of a character (3.1) and its encoding.
3.3 User-defined area private use area
The area that is reserved for use by the user of a product conforming to this standard.
3.4 字彙 repertoire
a specified set of characters (3.1) from a set of characters encoded by encoding characters (3.2) .
3.5 Reserved zone
Reserved for future assignment by this document.
4. Character repertoire
4.1 General remarks
The characters recorded in this document are encoded in single bytes, double bytes, or four bytes.
The single-byte part includes all 128 characters of 0x00~0x7F in GB11383-1989.
4.3 双字节部分
The double-byte part includes all the graphic characters in GB2312.1 1980 and the CJK unified ideographs in GB13000, as well as some graphic characters.
The characters in the double-byte part are defined according to Appendix A.
Among them, the description of the semantic characters should meet the requirements of Appendix B.
Note GB13000 is a unified encoding for Chinese, Japanese, Korea, Vietnam and other countries and regions.
Characters with unique abstract forms are assigned individual code positions, while characters with the same abstract forms but different origins are assigned shared code positions.
The coded Chinese characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK represents China, Japan and Korea.
4.4 Four-byte part

The four-byte sequence includes the 66 CJK Unified Ideographs (U+9FA6 to U+9FEF, excluding the 8 characters U+9FB4 to U+9FBB) and CJK Unified Ideographs Extension A, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension B, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension C, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension D, CJK Unified
The characters in the four-byte part are defined according to Appendix C.
5 Overall Structure of the System
In the text, numbers preceded by 0x are represented in hexadecimal, and numbers not preceded by 0x are represented in decimal.
In the appendix, all the encoded representations are in hexadecimal, and all other numbers are in decimal.
The single-byte part uses the encoding structure of GB11383-1989, using the code bits 0x00~0x7F.

The double-byte part uses two eight-bit binary digits to represent a character, and the first byte code bit starts from 0x81 and ends at 0xFE, and the last byte code bit is 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte part adopts the GB11383-1989 that does not adopt 0x30 to 0x39 as the suffix of the double-byte code extension, and the encoding range is 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The code range of the first character of a four-byte character is 0x81 to 0xFE; the code range of the second character is 0x30 to 0x39; the code range of the third character is 0x81 to 0xFE; the code range of the fourth character is 0x30 to 0x39. That is: 0x81308130 to 0
The overall structure and code point range allocation are shown in Fig. 1 and Table 1.
The order of 6-character arrangement
6.1 Single-byte character set order
The characters of the word mark part are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters in GB11383-1989.
6.2. Order of characters in double-width characters
The order of the subcharacters in a double-width character should be in accordance with Appendix A.
6.3 Four-character market part characters sorting order

The 50400 bits from 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39 correspond to all the characters in the GB13000 basic multilingual plane that are not included in the double-byte part, and are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters in the GB13000 basic multilingual plane.

From 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39, a total of 1058400 code points are used to map the 16 supplementary planes of GB13000, and the character sequence is completely arranged according to the code point sequence of the 16 supplementary planes of GB13000.
The order of characters in the four-byte part should be in accordance with Appendix C.

8. Description of parts of characters and codes
Some of the characters and/or their corresponding GBI 13000 code positions in some code positions have been adjusted relative to GB 18030-2005 (see Annex D).
9.1 General
This document defines three levels of implementation.
System software products conforming to the corresponding implementation level should provide input/output functionality for all characters within the range of the corresponding implementation level.
9.2 Implementation Level 1

Level 1 implementation shall support the CJK Unified Ideographs (i.e. 0x82358F33 to 0x82359636) and CJK Unified Ideographs Extension A (i.e. 0x8139EE39 to 0x82358738) in the single byte codec, double byte codec, and four byte code
Any product to which this document applies shall meet the requirements of Level 1 implementation.
Note: In accordance with software application requirements, implementation level 1 may also choose any one or more of the non-Chinese scripts listed in Table 3.
9.3 Implementation Level 2
Level 2 includes Level 1.
In addition, the implementation level 2 includes the encoding characters that are not included in the implementation level 1 in the "General Standard Chinese Character Table".
The code positions and glyphs of the Han characters listed in the "General Standard Chinese Character Table" are shown in Appendix.
System software and support software shall meet the requirements of Level 2 implementation.

Note: System software and application software include but are not limited to operating systems, database management systems, middleware (see GB36475 for information on software product classification).
9.4 Implementation Level 3
Level 3 includes Level 2.
In addition, level 3 includes all the Chinese characters specified in this document and the initial forms of the Kangxi radicals listed in Table 3.
Products used for government services and public services shall meet the requirements of level 3 implementation.

Note: The government services and public services industry includes but is not limited to railway transport, road transport, water transport, air transport, intermodal transport and transport agency, postal services, financial services, insurance, real estate, management, sanitation, national institutions, social security, etc. (See GB4754 for information on industry classification).

The contents of this manual page are taken from the complete documentation of the GNU C compiler, and are limited to explaining the meaning of options.
Unless someone volunteers to maintain them, EURo files and Info files are authoritative.
If there is a discrepancy between the manual page and the software, consult the Info documentation

If we notice that the content of this manual page is outdated and causes confusion and complaints, we will stop publishing it. There is no other choice, like updating Info files and updating man pages at the same time, because we do not have time to do this work while maintaining other Gnu cc work. The GNU project considers man pages to be outdated products and should spend time on other things.

For complete and up-to-date documentation, see the Info file `gee' or Using and Porting GNU CC (for version 2.0) (ft&/HAIZE#H GNU CC 2.0) manual, both of which are derived from the Texinfo source file gee.texinfo.
The description of the C and C++ compilers is integrated. They both process the input file using one or more of the four steps: preprocessing, Hii (compilation), (assembly) MERE (linking) .
The suffix identifies the language of the source file, but to the compiler, the suffix controls the default settings:
gcc considers the preprocessed file (.i) to be a C file, and sets up C linkage,
g++ thinks that the preprocessed file (.i) is a C++ file, and sets up C++ linkage.
The suffix of a source file name indicates the language type and the later operations:
.c C source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.C C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.cc C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.CXX C++ 源程序; 预处理, 编译, 链接
.m Objective-C source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.i Preprocessed c file; compile, assemble
.ii Preprocessed C++ files; compile, assemble
.s Assembly language source; assemble
assembly language source; preprocess, assemble
.h Preprocessor file; usually not shown on the command line other than files of lower rank being passed to the linker (Linker). Usually contains:
.0 目標文件 (Object file) [/
.a  Archive file
unless -cec or -s (or -E) options are used (or a compile error prevents the whole process), linking is always the last step.

during the link stage, all .e files corresponding to source files, -1 libraries, and filenames that are not recognized (including specified .o h files and .a libraries) are passed to the linker options (OPTIONS) in the order specified on the command line
Options must be given separately : de ' is not the same as `-d -r '.
Most `-=E :' and `-W' options have two opposite formats: `-fname' and `-fno-name' (or `-Wname' and `-Wno- name').
Only the non-default formats are listed here.
The following is a summary of all options, grouped by type, with explanations following in later sections.
Code Generation Options (Code Generation Option)
Overall Option [/
Specify the language of the input file that follows explicitly (rather than the default choice derived from the file name).
This option applies to all following input files until the next -x option.
No explicit specification of a language, so use the language implied by the filename extension after any processing of the file name by the `-r' option).

If you only want some of the stages of compilation (preprocessing, compilation, assembling, linking), you can use -x (or filename suffixes) to tell gcc where to start, and one of the options -c, -S, or -E to say where gcc is to stop.  Note, some option combinations (e.g., -x cpp-output -E) {i gee MEF =c compile or assemble source files
The resulting object file.
Stop after compilation, without assembling object files.

Pipelines are used between different stages of compilation rather than temporary files, because the assemblers in those systems cannot read from pipes; GNU as does not have this problem, and accepts C "dialect" that supports ANSI C programs.
This disables some GNU extensions that are not compatible with ANSI C, and some keywords that indicate rarely used ANSI trigraph features, such as unix and vax.
For function declarations with no parameters, such as `int foo ();', process as in C style -- that is, without specifying the number or type of arguments. (This applies only to C++.)
Normally, a function foo with this syntax means no parameters in C++.
The list of options from here on is deleted in an attempt to support some aspects of traditional C compilers.
See the NU c manual, we have removed the details, so that when the content becomes outdated, people will not HERI.
There is one exception: for C++ programs (not C), the `-traditional' option has an additional effect, allowing assignment to `this'.
It is the same as `-Ethis-is-variable' option.
-traditional-cpp tries to support some aspects of the traditional C preprocessor.
Especially the part about the preprocessor, but not the other effects of the -traditional option.
-fdollars-in-identifiers allows the `$' character in identifiers (only for C++).
You can specify `-Efno-dollars-in-identifiers' option to explicitly disallow use of `$' character.
(GNU C++ allows `$' by default on some target systems, but not all.)
-fenum-int-equiv allows implicit conversion from integer types to enumeration types (MEF c++) .
Normally, GNU C++ allows a conversion from enum to int, but not the other way around.
-fexternal-templates generates smaller code for template declarations (template declarations) (only in C++) by generating a copy of each template function only where they are defined.
To use this option successfully, you must mark all files that use templates with `#pragma implementation` (definition) or `#pragma interface` (declaration).
When compiling with -fexternal-templates, all template instantiations are external types. You must ensure that the required instantiations appear in the implementation file.
This can be achieved by typedef, which references each instance that is needed.
Correspondingly, if you compile with the default option `-fno-external-templates', all template instances are explicitly set to be inline.
All member functions (except constructors and mnew or delete member operators) are considered virtual in the class in which they are defined.
This does not mean that every call to a member function will go through the internal virtual function table.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a virtual function can be called directly; in such cases it is called directly.
-fcond-mismatch allows the types of the second and third parameters of a conditional expression to mismatch.
This expression has a value of Void. -fthis-is-variable allows assignment to this (only in C++).
Assignability of `this' is inappropriate after merging user-defined free-store management into C++.
Therefore, by default, an assignment to this in a class member function is an invalid operation.
However, for backward compatibility, you can make this operation valid by using the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
Each machine has its own default char type. It could be unsigned char or signed char.
Ideally, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char when it depends on the sign of the data.
However, many programs have been written using simple chars, and expect this to be a signed integer (or an unsigned integer, depending on the target machine of the program).
This option, and its opposite, make such programs work with the corresponding default values.
The type char should always be explicitly defined as either signed char or unsigned char, even though it may be represented exactly the same as one of the two.
If no ` signed' or ` unsigned' qualifier is specified, these options define a signed or unsigned bitfield.
By default, bitfields are signed, because they inherit the basic integer type, such as int, which is signed, but if the -traditional option is specified, bitfields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in the writable data segment and treats them specially.
This is for compatibility with some old programs that thought it was a very bad idea to make string constants writable; the `-traditional' option also has the same effect.
Executive Summary
COVID-19 Impact on the Drug Market
its effects may be similar to the 2008 economic crisis
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into uncharted territory.
In many countries, the disease has overwhelmed health services, brought them to the brink of collapse and caused severe disruptions to the global economy as governments have imposed restrictions.
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be profound.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to produce drugs as restrictions on movement also limit access to precursors and basic chemicals.
Traffickers, unable to travel, may have to find new routes and methods.
Patterns of drug use and supply may change, and governments' ability to respond may be hampered.
The changes brought about by COVID-19 are unprecedented, but there are lessons to be learned from previous crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some users started looking for cheaper synthetic substances and moved to injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments have cut funding for drug-related programs.

If governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way, prevention interventions and services to address drug use and related risk behaviours, as well as treatment services, may be heavily impacted.
Furthermore, the priority of interdiction and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to operate.
Some countries have seen large amounts of drugs smuggled through commercial flights, and it is expected that these countries will be most directly affected by drug trafficking.

Couriers have been known to carry large quantities of synthetic drugs such as methamphetamine in their hand luggage or concealed in their checked-in baggage. With almost all countries now imposing restrictions on air travel, the supply of drugs via commercial air travel may be completely disrupted.
While international postal supply chains have also been disrupted, activities involving the use of the dark web and mail order may increase.
In the long term , economic recession and associated measures may disrupt the drug market .

With rising unemployment and lack of opportunities, the poor and vulnerable are more likely to turn to drugs in harmful ways, become addicted, and turn to illegal activities related to production or transportation of drugs.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of the situation by providing services to vulnerable populations and recruiting new members to bolster their ranks.
With a diminished government response, these changes may take root quickly and become the new reality for many communities.
Expansion and complexity
Market growth
Population growth patterns partially explain the reasons for market expansion
The global drug problem has been growing, both in absolute numbers and as a proportion of the world population.

In 2009, an estimated 210 million people were drug users, representing 4.8% of the global population aged 15–64, and in 2018, an estimated 269 million people were drug users, representing 5.3% of this population.
In the past 20 years, the growth rate of drug abuse in developing countries has far exceeded that of developed countries.

This to some extent reflects the difference in overall population growth, with developed countries at 7% and developing countries at 28%, but also reflects the faster growth of young populations in developing countries.
The proportion of teenagers and young adults among drug users is the largest.
From 2000 to 2018, the population of this age group in developing countries increased by 16%, while the population of this age group in developed countries decreased by 10%.
1. Urbanization is a driving force for the current and future drug market.
In both developed and developing countries, the prevalence of drug use is higher in urban areas than in rural areas.

The overall increase in drug use is due to the large-scale migration of the population from rural areas to cities. At present, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared to 34% in 1960.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, especially in countries with more pronounced urbanization trends.
Increases in wealth are associated with increased drug use, but the greatest burden of disease is borne by the poorest people worldwide, and drug use is more widespread in developed countries.
Cocaine and the like are more strongly associated with wealthier parts of the world.
Similarly, within countries, the prevalence of drug use is higher among the more affluent social strata.
However, the rate of transition to drug addiction is higher among people with lower socio-economic status.
Data from a few countries show that harmful patterns of drug use are associated with disease and low income.
These patterns are less common in more affluent social strata .
The economic constraints of the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risk of the most vulnerable, including drug users.

For example , changes in the labor market , such as rising unemployment , have long been associated with increases in drug use , and the pandemic has already caused millions of people to lose their jobs worldwide .

COVID-19 may also lead to further expansion of the drug market , as the pandemic could lead to more farmers growing or engaging in illicit cultivation , or as a result of reduced capacity of regulatory authorities , or as a result of more people being pushed into illicit activities due to economic crisis.

COVID @-@ related restrictions have led to a reduction in air and road traffic , with a possible increase in maritime trafficking , which is less risky than air or road trafficking and involves larger quantities .
There have been recent reports of cocaine shipments being transported directly from South America to Europe by sea.
WE IMPROVE the ability of people to deal with complexity.
While the emergence of new types of non-controlled substances is stable, the potential risks of new types of opioids are increasing, and the drug market is becoming more complex.

In addition to plant-based substances such as cannabis, cocaine and heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added to the mix, many of which are not internationally controlled. Non-medical use of prescription drugs is also on the rise.
Member States have an average of 500 new psychoactive substances on their national markets each year.
Most of these are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a few synthetic opioids.
While the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportions have changed.

In 2014, new psychoactive substances classified as new synthetic opioids accounted for just 2% of the total number of new psychoactive substances confirmed that year, but by 2018, this figure had risen to 9%.
Many of the new synthetic opioids are fentanyl analogues, whose efficacy and harm have been proven, and which have caused overdose deaths in North America, with lesser degrees in other regions.
In North America , fentanyl is used as an adulterant for heroin and other drugs ( including cocaine and methamphetamine ) , and also as a precursor for counterfeit opioids .

Some evidence suggests that Europe is also seeing the emergence of injecting new psychoactive stimulants: a study of residues left in discarded syringes in six European cities found many to be contaminated with substances that produce stimulant effects
2 New psychoactive substances use may become increasingly entrenched in disadvantaged groups
Single types of new psychoactive substances almost never form large markets.
However, evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among homeless and prison populations.
Twenty-two countries reported use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with synthetic cannabinoids being the main challenge in most countries.

Innovation in the production of synthetic drugs is often driven by the need to circumvent controls on precursor chemicals, many of which are now internationally controlled for their use in the synthesis of amphetamine, methamphetamine and "ecstasy" and other drugs.
Traffickers and clandestine chemists have long sought out alternatives to controlled substances, including so-called "designer precursors" that are specifically designed to evade controls.
Restrictive measures aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19 may well put further pressure on those involved in the illicit manufacture of precursors.

Evidence from Mexico suggests this is already the case: reports in March 2020 that a shortage of methamphetamine precursors imported from Asia led to a rise in the price of methamphetamine in Mexico and the US.
in a fast-moving market.
Synthetic opioids replace heroin in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
The heroin market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018.
The amount of heroin seized by the Russian Federation authorities has fallen by around 80 % , while the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has fallen significantly.
But the stimulant market seems to be growing.
There is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including mephedrone and alpha-PVP, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.
Russian authorities report a dramatic increase in the number of secret laboratories producing illicit drugs, from 60 in 2016 to 152 in 2018.
Growth of the methamphetamine market in Afghanistan and Iraq
Investigations into hospital, prison and other personnel in Iraq had already revealed the importance of methamphetamine in 2012.
Crystal methamphetamine has become another major drug of concern, alongside fentanyl and tramadol.
A 2015 survey further confirmed these findings, with addicts saying that hashish was harder to get than "Captagon" or methamphetamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine laboratories, and the DEA has expressed concern over the large-scale importation of pseudoephedrine-based pills, which are used as precursors in methamphetamine laboratories.
In Afghanistan, methamphetamine production appears to have started in 2014.
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have steadily increased.
But the first half of 2019 saw a seizure of 657 kg - a sharp increase from the previous year.
Large quantities of methamphetamine seized in other countries and believed to be of Afghan origin also indicate that production is on the rise.
Policy changes and trends in change
Legalization of non-medical marijuana use has been associated with increased marijuana use in many jurisdictions
Canada, Uruguay, and 11 U.S. states allow for the production of cannabis products for nonmedical use.
In most of these jurisdictions, cannabis use has increased since legalization, although similar trends have been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized non-medical use.

In the two earliest states to legalize, Colorado and Washington, the prevalence of adult nonmedical cannabis use has increased, especially among those who use daily or almost daily and those who use in the past month, which have been above the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that cannabis use has increased in Uruguay since 2011 , with almost a doubling in use last month .
This suggests that the increase is primarily due to more frequent and frequent use.
Short @-term Canadian data also show that as the legal market has expanded from 2018 to 2019, use has increased.
However, in 2019, 40 percent of cannabis users still obtained some products from an illicit source.
Is the global drop in cannabis herb seizures due to legalization?
In 2018, global seizures of cannabis herb fell to their lowest levels in two decades, due to a 84 per cent drop in North America over the past 10 years.

In contrast, seizures in the rest of the world almost doubled over the same period. The seizure pattern suggests that policies aimed at opening up the cannabis market have played a key role in the decline.

The impact of regulation on new psychoactive substances seems to be having a dampening effect, but it is still difficult to evaluate the impact of regulation on new psychoactive substances within the country.
Some countries that have adopted different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances have shown different patterns of use of new psychoactive substances.
In other countries, the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after the introduction of national legislation.
vulnerable populations are harmed by both legal and illicit drug markets for pain and palliative care with opioids, which are disproportionately available in high @-@ income regions .
In 2018 , more than 90 % of all opioids available for medical consumption were in high-income countries .
About 50 % are in North America , 40 % in Europe , and 2 % in Oceania .
These countries account for about 12% of the world's population.
Estimates suggest that 88 % of the global population live in low- and middle-income countries, but less than 10 % of the consumption of pharmaceutical opioids occurs there.
Access to prescription opioids is influenced by a range of factors , including legislation , culture , health systems , and prescribing practices .
The risk of addiction is higher among poorer people, with an estimated 35.6 million people affected in 2018.

Poverty , limited education , and social marginalization may increase the risk of opioid use disorder and exacerbate its consequences . Studies from high - income countries have shown this , with individual social economic trajectories not only reflecting a person's status at a given time but also being associated with the risk of opioid use disorder .

Opioid use disorder can further exacerbate social and economic disadvantage , increasing the risk of unemployment , poverty , and homelessness , and thus perpetuating disadvantage in a vicious cycle . These outcomes may also be related to the demeaning attitudes and consequences of the criminal justice system .

women , minorities , migrants , sexual minorities , and people displaced by conflict or disaster , as well as those in rural settings , may be disproportionately affected by opioid use disorder or may face barriers to treatment .

harmful tobacco use has had increasingly broad social impacts over the past decade , as measured by the disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ year ( DALY ) indicator , which estimates the years of healthy life lost to disability and premature death .
Between 2007 and 2018, the global disability adjusted life years attributable to smoking increased by 17 %.
The increase in DALYs attributable to untreated hepatitis C related liver cancer among people who inject drugs was particularly high , at 40 % .
The complex relationship between drugs and violence is difficult to determine the full causal relationship between substance use and violence.
limited global data suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicide .
However , alcohol appears to have a greater role in violent events than drugs.

although drug use may be associated with crime , in some cases this association can be partly attributed to a range of intervening factors , including social and economic disadvantage and other types of adversity that are influenced by individual risk factors , family environment , and peer influences .
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted .

If there are established criminal structures , including large - scale organized criminal activities such as international drug trafficking , violence may not be necessary to achieve the objectives of the criminal enterprise .

In the short term , the presence and degree of violence are more likely to be determined by changes in the balance of power between organized criminal groups - for example , changes in the size of the illicit market , the death or imprisonment of prominent criminals , or law enforcement measures that make one group vulnerable to another .
View the latest trends
Opioids continued to cause the most harm, accounting for 76 per cent of deaths where drug use disorders were implicated.
An estimated 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
In comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
But the associated harms of opioids have been overlooked because of the relatively small number of users.

In the estimated 167,000 deaths in 2017 related to drug use disorders, 66 per cent were caused by these substances, and in the 21 million years of life lost due to disabilities or premature death attributed to drug use disorders, 50 per cent were caused by these substances.
Synthetic Opioids Worsen Public Health Crisis

In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the opioid crisis is driven by tramadol; in North America, it is driven by fentanyl. These two regions have little in common economically, demographically, or in terms of general patterns of drug use, but both are grappling with opioid crises fueled by the availability of cheap, easily produced substances.
In North America , the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has driven a 20 @-@ year increase in opioid overdose deaths .
in 2018 , fentanyl was involved in two thirds of the 67,367 registered overdose deaths in the United States .
Canada has reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
Part of the reason fentanyl is causing overdose deaths is that the drug effects are unpredictable on the illicit drug market.
In West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa, the market for tramadol for non-medical purposes has grown significantly.
In the region, the number of patients with opioid use disorder treated with tramadol is increasing.
In 2017, global seizures of tramadol reached a peak of more than 125 tons.
But in 2018, with the introduction of a new law regulating tramadol in India, global seizures fell to 32 tons.
The crises in both regions have been driven by the ease and low cost of production, as well as the lack of international controls on tramadol and many fentanyl analogues and precursors.
The worsening of these crises is due to the availability of these substances on both the legal and illicit markets, making them harder to detect and prevent.
Stimulant use is on the rise
The stimulant market is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine, both of which are seeing rising use in their main markets.
Some 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, as it remains popular in North America and Western Europe.
Some 27 million people used methamphetamine in 2018, with methamphetamine being the most commonly used amphetamine-type stimulant in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to most indicators, methamphetamine use has been growing in both regions over the past two decades.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes substituting for one another, so that when use of one drug goes up, use of the other goes down, and sometimes both go up and down in tandem to meet market demand.
COVID-19 raises risks for injection drug users
An estimated 11.3 million people injected drugs in 2018, and about 10% of the global HIV epidemic was due to injection drug use.
More than 100,000 people who inject drugs are living with HIV, and 5.5 million have hepatitis C.
In 2017, an estimated 585,000 people died from drug use, half of whom died from liver disease caused by hepatitis C, while many injecting drug users with hepatitis C remain untreated.

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Official: Reception Process Bottleneck-China News
EU summit dominated by refugee policy disputes, EU official: bottlenecks exist in every step of the reception process

(Global Times Brussels Special Correspondent Ni Ruifei) According to Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said that EU leaders agreed to adopt more stringent policies on illegal immigration to make it easier to expel illegal immigrants.

According to the report, the EU's move is a response to the growing problem of illegal immigration in Europe. Now, the core problem of the EU is that the number of illegal immigrants who can be deported is very small.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize large amounts of EU funds" to strengthen external borders with infrastructure and monitoring.
However, the EU and its member states have been at odds over who should pay for border costs.
Von der Leyen has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

However, some diplomats of member states said that if the EU could share the cost of installing cameras, lighthouses and other facilities along the external border, it would help the countries to increase their budgets and speed up the construction process.

Euractiv, a European website, said that EU officials admitted that there were bottlenecks in every step of the refugee reception process, and that the limited reception capacity and the overburdened migration authorities of the member states could not prevent refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in various EU countries, and that the EU's refugee reception system was in a "near permanent crisis".
According to the European Commission, EU countries received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of nearly half compared with the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded more than 33,000 illegal entries last year.

Against this background, the summit also agreed on a "principle" agreement, which allows EU countries to return illegal immigrants to another member state based on the judgment of the court of that member state.
In addition, it was reported that the EU leaders agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which would pave the way for the EU to draw up a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Ni Ruifei)

In

In recent years, the United States has never stopped attacking China's "chip" development. On the one hand, it has accurately pressured the supply chain of the semiconductor industry in China, and on the other hand, it has built a "de-Sinicization" semiconductor industry chain alliance to completely "cut off" China from the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to establish a "technical alliance" with South Korea, or to establish a "chip four-party alliance" with South Korea, Japan, and Taiwan, or to establish a "small circle" of the semiconductor industry chain through mechanisms such as the US-Japan-India-Australia "Quadrilateral Mechanism" and the "Indo-Pacific Economic Framework", the United States has introduced political, factional, and

The so-called suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry by the United States has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.

Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, it is weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technology and skilled workers, and is heavily dependent on the Asia-Pacific region.

Even if the United States tries to lead the advanced semiconductor production and supply chain to develop in the "small circle" area, it is difficult to change the regional distribution and mutual dependence of the global semiconductor-related industries.
The United States is strongly "reforming" and "de-Sinicization" of the semiconductor industry chain, and re-creating the global semiconductor industry.

In the short term, the United States has indeed caused trouble for China's semiconductor industry and related industries, and reaped real benefits.

However, in the long run, the US’s hysteria and pressure on China’s semiconductor industry will lead to China’s continuous breakthroughs, which will ultimately cause the US to lose a huge Chinese market, and will greatly damage the innovative willingness and ability of US technology companies, and harm the development of the global semiconductor industry.

First batch of individual pension financial products goes on sale, with the shortest holding period of 360 days - Chinanews.com
First batch of individual pension financial products goes on sale
Seven products are available for selection, with the minimum holding period of 360 days.
Personal pension financial products have finally been launched.

On February 10, China Finance Network published the list of the first batch of personal pension financial products, and the seven personal pension financial products of Guobao Finance, Nongbao Finance, and Zhongyou Finance were officially launched.

At this point, the "shelf" of personal pension accounts has finally gathered four types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public fund products.

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal pension financial products are all public offering net value open products, of which 5 are newly issued products and 2 are continuous products. Except for 1 mixed product, the remaining 6 products are all fixed income products.

According to the reporter of Beijing Youth Daily, among the 5 new products, 4 come from GuoBao Life, all of which are fixed-income products. The minimum holding period is 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) are 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% -

The remaining new issue product is "China Post Financial Wealth Addition·Hongjin No. 1, with the shortest holding period of 1095 days", which is also a fixed-income product. It started collecting funds on February 10 and ended on February 19, with a risk level of II.

One of the two continuing products is the Agricultural Bank of China's "Agricultural Bank of China Same Heart · Spirit Dynamic" 360-day Technology Innovation RMB Financial Product, which has a mixed investment nature and a risk level of three.

The other perpetual product is "China Post Financial Wealth Addition·Hongjin No. 1, the shortest holding period of 365 days", which is a fixed income type. It started collecting last year on December 30, and officially started operating on January 4 this year. The cumulative net value on February 8 was 1.0011.

According to the Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Personal Pension Funds, the financial products that can be invested in by the funds of the personal pension fund account include bank wealth management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, public fund, etc.

The first batch of individual pension insurance financial products went on sale, marking that individual pension investors can officially purchase financial products through individual pension insurance funds account.
Last November, the CBIRC issued the Temporary Measures for the Administration of Commercial Banks and Trust Companies' Business of Individual Retirement Savings.

The Regulations stipulate that participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance products, personal pension public fund products and other personal pension products through their personal pension capital accounts.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice, clarifying that the pension system for individual accounts was launched in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang and Xiongan New Area in Hebei Province, and Jincheng City in Shanxi Province.

By the end of 2022, the number of people participating in personal pension insurance was 19.54 million, the number of people paying was 6.13 million, and the total amount of contributions was 14.2 billion yuan.
Previously, banks participating in the pilot only listed three types of products, namely private pension savings, private pension insurance, and private pension public fund products.
Now that the financial products of personal pension have gathered, how should investors choose?

An expert from the research and development department of Bank of Communications Financial Products said that compared with other personal pension products, the pension financial products and personal pension financial products in the pilot stage have three characteristics.
First, stability, the risk management mechanism is more complete, the investment strategy and ideas are more stable, and third-party independent custody is implemented.

Second, the long-term nature, the trial period of retirement financial products all have a term of more than 5 years, and the next issue of personal pension financial products, the minimum holding period is generally 1 year, and encourage holding for more than 3 years.

Three is inclusiveness, the purchase threshold of the product is low, the initial purchase point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan, and the custody fee, management fee and other fees of the product are more preferential.
Professionals pointed out that investors should choose products based on the product features and their risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have the characteristics of longer term, higher interest rates and higher security, and are suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products focus on protection, and are more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risks and are willing to accept stable returns; while personal pension financial products and public fund products do not guarantee principal or returns, have certain investment risks, but have higher expected returns, and are suitable for people who have certain financial knowledge and risk tolerance.
Editorial / Reporter of this newspaper: Cheng Pei / Coordinator / Pool Hai-bo
Fitness Industry Should Overcome Trust Crisis - Eastday.com
Another "storm" in the fitness industry?
Recently, the issue of the members of the well-known fitness institution Jianjian Fitness Club demanding their rights has attracted public attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that the branch where they were located was not operating normally. Subsequently, rumors about the closure of the institution caused members to panic, leading to the intervention of the public security and human resources departments.
Finally, the relevant responsible person came forward to respond and promised to make efforts to protect the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, which helped to calm the storm.

When individual fitness centers have some of their stores encountering operational problems and temporarily closing, consumers can be calm and wait for the problem to be resolved. Why do some members have the first reaction of "something is wrong"?
Behind the fitness club member rights protection storm, there is a deep-seated problem of trust crisis in the industry.
In China, traditional gyms generally adopt the prepaid model, and "earning money when users don't come" is the bottom line of their development.
By selling membership cards to obtain cash flow, opening new stores, it seems that they can be circulated, but in fact, they are eating their own rice, and cannot form a stable profit model.
Negative information about the fitness industry and other industries is frequently released, which has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the perspective of market prospects, fitness clubs are indeed a "money-making" good business.
Although the fitness industry is up and down, it is always attracting capital attention.
A number of data show that the demand for cultural consumption and other areas is constantly increasing, and the market is continuously warming up.

Specifically, in the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents' living standards and the deepening of the concept of healthy living, the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the prospects, the more the industry needs to focus on quality development.

However, individual institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the consumption recovery, and they blow the horn of opening up and expanding after getting out of the crisis, and pour the funds for financing into the construction of new stores.

It cannot be denied that, influenced by the epidemic, many institutions have withdrawn, and the industry has reshuffled. Real enterprises have selectively increased their acquisition strength and restructured, which is indeed a new opportunity.
However, in order for the fitness market to develop into a virtuous cycle and to take the first step towards stability, the industry must change its traditional mode and change its business strategy.
Only by laying a solid foundation, rebuilding the trust and safety of consumers, can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared with the expansion of new stores to occupy the market, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing services and using high-quality development to stabilize users.
First, we need to retain customers through service.

Fitness clubs belong to the service industry, and their essence is to adhere to the "user-oriented" principle, to closely surround the needs of users, and to put the focus of operations on service quality upgrades.
Secondly, it is necessary to improve the user experience through digital transformation.
For example, the current popular Internet fitness model allows users to pay per visit and choose the venue.
At the same time, physical data and sports data can be effectively used to meet social needs and achieve a complete service loop from online to offline.
Without personal training promotion and without large annual cards, users' concerns about "running away" from fitness institutions have been reduced, and trust has been improved.
In addition, it is necessary to actively explore multiple business models.

Now, sports consumption has evolved from single services to scene consumption, and fitness clubs have the potential to become a new entry point for consumption, and the fitness equipment and accessories around the fitness will become a new profit point, providing consumers with more choices.

Nanjing Loushi Repeats "Difference in Price Refund" - China News.com

Yangtze Evening Post (Reporter: Ma Shi-bo) Yangtze Evening Post/Zhiniu News (Reporter: 10th) In an interview, it was found that the “price agreement” had returned to Nanjing Luzhou after more than ten years. A Luzhou apartment claimed to offer “difference payment” and that the discounts on other properties were greater than the previous discounts. The developer was willing to exchange
The conditions of the "price agreement" are not necessarily low
The developer of the apartment is called Bohai Yuzhou Cloud Terrace, and the buyer Mr. Sun told the reporter that he found a "declaration" when he visited the apartment last weekend.

The picture he sent to the reporter showed that the developer of the apartment complex promised that for any apartment purchased between February 1 and February 28, from the day the purchase and sale contract was signed to the day the apartment was delivered, if the discount for other apartments in the project was greater than the discount for the apartment purchased before (limited to other apartments of the same type, in the same building, in the same unit, and of the same property type as the apartment purchased),

Mr Sun said that the real estate consultant said that this was actually a "price guarantee", which was to make the buyers feel at ease to buy, and not to worry that the developer would lower the price to promote sales, "Now I'm afraid that after buying it, it will be lowered, and there will be a lot of trouble at the sales office, and if there is no trouble, it is indeed a heartache."
However, many buyers believe that the "price guarantee" is just a "pill to calm the nerves" for buyers, but the conditions are not low.

Ms. Zheng, who plans to buy a house in Jiangbei, said that the price-protected houses must be the same type, in the same building, and in the same unit. The buyer can only choose a few price-protected houses, so the "threshold" is still high.
Some buyers also believe that due to information asymmetry, when selling, it is not impossible to give extra discounts, so the difficulty of buyers' "protection" is not small.
Whether the buyers can stay remains to be seen.

The reporter learned from the online real estate platform of Nanjing that the sale permit of the apartment was 252 units in total for the two buildings in November last year, with the house types of 105 square meters, 114 square meters, 129 square meters, and the average price of the full decoration was 39,843 yuan/m2.

However, two months have passed, and the online real estate market shows that the current total number of unsold units in the building is 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 8th floor has a total of 128 units, with 113 unsold units, and 7th floor has 124 units, with 44 unsold units. Market insiders said that "price agreement" also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the Huxi Huangshan Road project, Xihu West Garden, in order to attract buyers, launched the "Price Protection Plan", which means that the company will refund the difference to the original owner if the discount of the project is expanded within one year.
After that, in April 2011, nine residential projects in Nanjing also offered some apartments with a "price difference refund" guarantee.
"The housing market is warming up, and now is the time for a "stimulant".
"Senior trader Mr. Shen of the real estate industry in Nanjing said that "price guarantee" is also one of the marketing methods of real estate companies.
He believes that developers need confidence more than buyers do, and that the "price guarantee" is a way to boost their confidence.
As for whether they can keep the buyers, he said that it depends on the influence of multiple factors such as the control policy and the loan threshold, and it still needs to be observed.
Multiple data show decline, Taiwan economy starts the year with poor performance - China News Network

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11 (Reporters: Zhao Bo, Huang Yang) Export trade volume "connected five black", the purchasing managers' index (PMI) of manufacturing industry has been continuously shrinking for 7 months, and the consumer price index (CPI) has seen "three-character head" ... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have been releasing economic data for January 2023.
Experts believe that Taiwan's economy has not performed well at the beginning of the year, and the pressure of growth is not small.

According to the financial affairs management department of the Taiwan government, Taiwan's exports in January this year were US$31.51 billion, down 21.2% year-on-year, and negative growth for the fifth consecutive month.
The export value of 11 major export commodities all fell compared with the same period last year.
Plastic rubber and its products, and optical instruments fell the most, with a decrease of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
Exports of electronic components fell 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decline in 11 years.
Among them, integrated circuits fell 18.3% year-on-year, the largest drop in 14 years.

Cai Mei-na, director of the statistics department of the Ministry of Finance, said that this shows that the weak demand for consumer electronics has spread, and the electronics industry has entered a correction period.
Statistics show that in January, Taiwan's imports and exports both fell, and the export amount was only US$2.34 billion, the lowest level in the past three years.

Taiwan’s financial authorities believe that the global terminal demand is decreasing, the industry adjustment of inventory is suppressing the merchant’s willingness to purchase, and the export slump is difficult to see improvement in the short term. Taiwan’s export decline in the first quarter of the year may be higher than expected.

According to the Chung-Hua Institution for Economic Research in Taiwan, the manufacturing purchasing managers’ index (PMI) in Taiwan in January was 40.4% after seasonal adjustment, a decrease of 3.3 percentage points from the previous year, and a continuous decline for seven months.
In the economic monitoring index system, PMI is the line of stagnation, and the index greater than 50% represents the expansion of the situation, and vice versa.
In the five components of the PMI in Taiwan in January, new orders, production and employment were shrinking, delivery time of suppliers was declining, and inventory was shrinking.

All six industries reported a decline in PMI, with the ranking of the decline speed as follows: electrical and mechanical equipment industry (35.1%), electronic and optical industry (35.2%), chemical and pharmaceutical industry (39.2%), basic raw material industry (42.4%), transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and food and textile industry (45.7%).

In terms of prices, the "Directorate General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics" of the Taiwan government announced that the annual increase of CPI in January 2020 was 3.04%, which exceeded 3% again since July 2019.
Among them, vegetable prices rose 28.25%, setting a new high in 17 months.

Cao Zhihong, a special commissioner of the Taiwan "Bureau of Statistics", admitted that the increase in vegetable prices was indeed greater than expected. Excluding the Spring Festival factor, the average CPI in January and February this year should be close to 2.71% in December last year, and the inflationary pressure still exists and is still at a high level.
Looking forward to Taiwan's economy this year, according to the reports of United Daily News and "Yahoo Finance" and other domestic media, experts are pessimistic.

Professor Wu Daren of the Economics Department of Central University in Taiwan analyzed that the export downturn may cause cash flow problems for exporters in the manufacturing industry, and the risk of debt default will increase.
At the same time, the reduction in orders led to the reduction of labor costs for enterprises, which affected the labor market and family economy, and in turn affected the consumption ability.

According to Qiu Dashan, a researcher at the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, the inflation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved, and the demand continues to shrink. It is estimated that the export decline in Taiwan will continue into the first half of the year.
Since Taiwan's economy relies on exports, it is affected by the decline in exports, and the annual economic growth will not be as good as last year.

Beijing, February 11 (Door Ruixi) The 2022 China Returnee Employment Survey Report (hereinafter referred to as the “Report”) released recently shows that the scale of the 2022 graduating students increased by 8.6% compared to the previous year, the number of returnee students seeking employment reached a new high, and the demand for foreign talents of Chinese enterprises also showed an upward trend.

The report pointed out that since 2020, the number of returning students seeking employment in China has significantly increased, and the number of graduating students seeking employment has increased.
Compared with 2021, the number of graduating students in 2022 increased by 8.6% over the same period, and the number of students returning to seek employment set a new record.

From the distribution of the countries where the students who returned to China to seek employment studied, the United Kingdom had the highest proportion, at 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), which were the same as in 2021.

From the perspective of year-on-year growth, the number of students from Malaysia, Japan, and Singapore who are expected to graduate in 2022 has increased significantly compared to the previous year, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9%, and 37.7%, respectively.
The number of expected graduates from Canada, Germany, the United States and Australia decreased compared with the previous year.
2023 Spring Festival After the First Week of Returnees' Supply and Demand Trends

The survey showed that 58% of the students who decided to return home thought that "life in China is more convenient", 40% decided to return home because they "felt more at home in the Chinese cultural environment", 32% thought that "there are more job opportunities in China", and 22% thought that "the economic activities in China will recover faster, and there will be more job opportunities".
The data shows that the demand for foreign talents by domestic enterprises is rapidly released, and the demand for returning talents is on the rise.

After the Spring Festival of 2023, the number of priority positions for returning overseas Chinese and the number of returning overseas Chinese seeking jobs both showed an upward trend, with the number of priority positions for returning overseas Chinese increasing by 11% compared to January 28, and the number of returning overseas Chinese seeking jobs increasing by 27%.
In terms of industry, in 2022, the proportion of positions for returning students was 27.8%, ranking first, followed by professional services/consulting (14.3%) and Internet/e-commerce (11.1%).
Changes in the number of returnees seeking employment in China in recent years. Source: 2022 China Returnee Employment Survey Report.

From the perspective of salary, the average recruitment salary of priority return positions has been increasing for three consecutive years, reaching 14,680 yuan/month in 2022 (RMB, same below), an increase of 961 yuan over 2021, and a growth of 7%.

From the perspective of regions, the intention of the returning group to develop in new first-tier cities, second-tier cities, and third-tier cities and below in 2022 all increased, with the submission ratio being 31%, 15.7%, and 14.3% respectively, all higher than the submission ratio in 2021.
For the harvest of studying abroad, 52.7% of the returnees said that it basically met their expectations, an increase of 2.8 percentage points compared with last year (49.9%).
28.2% of the returnees said that their achievements were higher or much higher than expected, which was higher than 25.4% in 2021.

Shenzhen: Building the first and world-leading extreme frontier city in China - Eastday

China News Service, February 11 - According to the information released on the WeChat public account of the Shenzhen Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology on the 10th, the Shenzhen Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology recently issued the "Shenzhen Extreme Frontier City Construction Action Plan".

It proposed that by the end of 2023, a high-speed, large-capacity, low-latency super broadband network will be built, achieving the goal of "double gigabit, all-optical network, 1 millisecond, and everything connected", and building the first and world-leading ultra-fast frontier city in China.
The plan proposes to accelerate the upgrade of gigabit optical networks.
By the end of 2023, the share of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of all-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires that the efficiency of 5G networks be comprehensively improved.
Research and formulate the quality standards for 5G network services in Shenzhen, carry out 5G network testing and evaluation, and improve the quality of 5G network services.

Support the telecommunications operators to increase the optimization intensity of the key areas and places of 5G network, and add 10,000 new 5G base stations throughout the year, with the average download speed in the city reaching 500Mbps and the average upload speed reaching 100Mbps, the download speed in the key areas reaching 1000Mbps and the upload speed reaching 200Mb
Build a city-level high-quality wireless local area network.

Public wireless local area network (WLAN) service standards are formulated, and the upgrade of WLAN in areas with high density of people and high demand for information consumption is promoted to provide gigabit access capability.

Relying on the construction of the city's public wireless local area network unified authentication and management platform, "one authentication, seamless roaming, intelligent switching" will be realized, and the operators will support the inclusion of social self-built APs (wireless access points) with public service capabilities in the authentication management platform.
By the end of 2023, the total number of upgraded access APs will not be less than 20,000.

In addition, the Plan also proposed to build a high-quality all-optical power network, construct a multi-layered computing supply system, speed up the construction of key communication networks, and improve the ability of Internet applications and services.
The plan clearly states that the construction of the smart connection system will be carried out in collaboration.

Explore the construction of the city perception terminal construction management mode based on the "OpenHarmony" operating system, reduce the cost of interconnection, accelerate the construction of the city-level perception platform, promote the city-level IoT platform and the networking and data interconnection of various professional IoT platforms in various fields.

Deepen the application of IoT in urban management, public services, public security, transportation, and other fields, and expand the fixed perception and intelligent network connection channels for vehicles, such as taxis, and mobile perception collection channels.

By the end of 2023, the number of IoT sensing terminals for water, electricity, and gas will exceed 9 million, and 20+ multi-functional smart lamppost application demonstration projects will be built.

The Plan also mentions that efforts will be made to strengthen the application of satellite and terrestrial communication integration, build the infrastructure of low-altitude networks, and promote the deep coverage of 5G networks in the sea.

At the same time, it will promote the deep coverage of maritime 5G networks, build an ecosystem for industrial innovation and development, and support the holding of top-level competitions and activities.

China’s e-commerce industry is facing a new variable. How can delivery companies achieve “content is king”?
Chinanews is an important news website in China.
China News Service, February 11 - Title: “New Variables” Emerge in China’s E-commerce Industry, How Can Delivery Services Achieve “Content is King”?
China News Service Financial News reporter Xia Bin
"We entered the e-commerce market a bit late, but we realized from the very beginning that in order to stand out from the millions of stores, content is very important.
"Floral" is a supplementary foodstuff store run by a "90s" girl from Guangdong on Douyin e-commerce, which helps a 30-year-old offline store to "bloom" online.
With the old Hong Kong movie style and classic Cantonese songs, opening @芳芳一人食 TikTok account, the beautiful video is a fresh experience.

At the recent "Seeking Peers and Sharing Quality Content" event for TikTok e-commerce, Fangfang, as a representative of quality creators, spoke and introduced her daily creation experience and insights.

She said at the event, "The carefully crafted videos have attracted a lot of attention from netizens, and many people are interested in the ingredients in my home and want to make food with me, which has opened up a sales channel.

By making more people fall in love with the taste of Guangdong through her soup-making video, Flora has sold up to 300,000 supplementary ingredients in a live broadcast, saving her family's old shop from the brink of closure.
"No content, no e-commerce", with the continuous development of short videos and live e-commerce, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stage of live delivery, the live room often used low prices and discounts to attract users, and price advantage seemed to be the only selling point at that time.

In recent years, there are not only phenomenon-level big Vs such as Liu Zhiming and Dongfang Zhenxuan, but also many unknown experts and merchants who have appeared in vertical fine-grained fields. They have continuously created high-quality content that is in line with their brand image, thus improving their long-term operating efficiency.

High Ashen, the operator of the star author of Douyin e-commerce, introduced that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have turned their content into reality through Douyin e-commerce, and the growth of content creation is 252%, and the total transaction amount is more than twice.
"Behind these numbers, we can feel a vibrant and lively author ecosystem.
Said High Ashen.

Previously, Beijing Normal University’s Communication Innovation and Future Media Experiment Platform published the “E-commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report”, which analyzed the importance of “new variables” in the current e-commerce industry, namely high-quality content, from the perspective of data, and used the index to evaluate the ecosystem of content in 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the E-commerce industry content ecosystem health index ranking in the report, Douyin Shop, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked first to fifth.

The report believes that the e-commerce content ecosystem is a comprehensive concept, which is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Good PGC (professional user-generated content) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers for integration with e-commerce. The higher the value of the content platform, the richer the consumption and promotion scenarios, and the higher the possibility of e-commerce being embedded

On the scene, Professor Yu Guoming, the director of the China Media Economy and Management Special Committee of the Communication University of China School of Journalism and Communication, analyzed and interpreted the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the current e-commerce industry has transitioned from the "accessibility of consumption" to the "quality of consumption" stage, and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the foundation and handle of the new stage of e-commerce development, and knowledge payment, professional knowledge, KOL (key opinion leader) and other PGC content have begun to become standard in e-commerce live broadcasting.
Looking forward to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Yum Guoming put forward two suggestions from two aspects.

One is to look at the improvement of content structure and promote the overall improvement of the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecosystem, establish standards for positive content creation and management, and realize the dynamic balance of the e-commerce industry content ecosystem health index system.
The other is to look at the external ecology, to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value of cooperation and co-creation with the external environment.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry still needs more data and AI support to predict stability for future development; in addition, it is necessary to provide more regulated and healthy growth space for merchants, realize the value collaboration and co-creation of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and promote the healthy ecosystem of content.

Chinese rescue team continues rescue operations in Turkey, rescues 4 trapped people - Chinanews.com

China News Service, February 11 - According to the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management on February 11, on February 10, the Chinese rescue team in Turkey dispatched three action teams and 45 rescue personnel, and rescued one trapped person.
Two search and assessment teams were also dispatched to evaluate and inspect 15 buildings on Wodabash Street.
So far, 4 people have been rescued and 5 people have been found dead. 25 collapsed buildings with severe damage have been searched for signs of life and risk assessments have been made.
The rescue team will scientifically adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation in the disaster area and the rescue scene, and continue to carry out rescue work in depth.

The rescue team obtained rescue assistance information through various channels such as the embassy, local government, and United Nations rescue organizations, and verified them through online inquiries, on-site searches, and other means.
The Chinese Hong Kong Rescue Team was introduced to the current rescue environment and the situation of building collapse, and they will work together to carry out search actions.

Currently, the team is responsible for coordination in the area with the Italian rescue team (SSC5), and has sent 3 members to participate in the work of the 5th area rescue coordination center, communicating with the Italian, British, Serbian, Slovak, Oman and other rescue teams, and understanding the rescue work of the United Nations rescue organizations and rescue teams of various countries.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team protection, and according to the principle of "unity of command and safety first", strengthened the safety management of the rescue scene, strengthened the requirements of rescue work discipline, and clarified the safety precautions.
The shift duty and sentry system are operated continuously, and the safety management of the camp is strengthened.

The medical personnel of the rescue team provide physical examination services for the team members every day, strengthen the medical protection of key personnel, and all the members of the rescue team are in good health, and the camp is being disinfected.

After the establishment of the camp, the logistics support personnel jointly built 26 tents of 4 categories, including command and communication, equipment storage, medical cleaning and disinfection, living accommodation and kennels, to ensure the supply of more than 30 sets of rescue equipment on the scene.

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) On Friday (February 10), the Biden administration will add six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the spy balloon program to the blacklist.

The US Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institution have helped the Chinese military modernize, especially in the aerospace field, including airships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist will find it difficult to obtain U.S. technology exports.

The list is called the "entity list", and companies listed on it will not be able to purchase technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they obtain a special export license from the U.S. Department of Commerce.

The companies listed are: Beijing South River Aerospace Technology Co Ltd, China Electronics Technology Group Corporation 48th Research Institute, Dongguan Lingshang Technology Co Ltd, Yuanmen Aviation Technology Group Co Ltd, Guangzhou Tianhai Xingshang Aviation Technology Co Ltd and Shanxi Yuanmen Aviation Technology Group Co Ltd.
Before this, the White House said it was considering broader measures to "expose and counter" broader surveillance operations by China that threaten US national security.
The balloon incident further strained US-China relations, prompting US Secretary of State Blinken to cancel his visit to China.

On February 4, the United States shot down the balloon, and the Chinese government made a serious protest to the US embassy in China, criticizing the United States for seriously violating and damaging the efforts and progress of both sides to stabilize the Sino-US relationship.

Based on existing debris evidence and information from China's military procurement platform, the U.S. government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is an approved supplier of the Chinese military.

Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning said at a press conference on Friday that China has repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position regarding the accidental intrusion of a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle into US airspace due to unavoidable circumstances.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress was purely political manipulation and hype.
China is strongly dissatisfied and firmly opposed to this.

Matthew Axelrod, Assistant Secretary of the Department of Commerce responsible for export control, said, "Today's action demonstrates our shared efforts to uncover and stop China's use of surveillance balloons that have violated U.S. and dozens of other countries' airspace.
"We are taking action today to make clear that our efforts to uncover and stop China's use of surveillance balloons that violate U.S. and dozens of other countries' airspace are shared priorities.
Reuters reported that an employee of Guangzhou Tianhe Xinghang Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd. said that he did not know about the sanctions and declined to comment further.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States has not yet commented on this information.
