(Deutsche Welle Chinese) Several days have passed since the earthquake hit parts of Turkey and Syria, and the hope of finding survivors is fading, but the rescue of a family of five on Saturday brought joy to the rescuers.

According to the Associated Press, the family of five was rescued after being trapped under the rubble for more than five days in the town of Nurdağı in Gaziantep province, one of the worst-hit areas.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from a pile of debris, and then found the father, but he insisted on saving his son and another daughter first.
When they were all rescued, the crowd cheered.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were also rescued from the rubble in the freezing cold.
"What day is it today?
"A boy who was trapped under the rubble for 129 hours asked the rescue worker who carried him out:
A man in Kahramanmaras holds his newly rescued cat
The success stories have given a glimmer of hope to a search operation that had been losing hope, but the number of people still missing continues to rise.
The official death toll from Monday's quake has now passed 20,000 in Turkey, with more than 3,500 in neighbouring Syria, according to official figures.
Despite experts saying people can survive for more than a week trapped in rubble, the hope of finding more survivors is fading.
Rescuers are still using thermal imaging cameras to search for signs of life under the rubble.
But now the focus of the rescue effort is turning to helping those who are most in need of help.
UN official: 'Century-defining' disaster in Turkey and Syria

Martin Griffiths, the UN Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator, said at a news conference in Turkey that the quake was the worst disaster to hit the region in a century.
He also praised Turkey's "unusual" response to the disaster.
He told Reuters he hoped aid could be delivered to both government and opposition-controlled areas in Syria, but said the situation was "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in aid to the Syrian earthquake victims.
Earlier this week, the United Nations announced it was allocating $25 million for relief efforts in Turkey and Syria.
The world's most powerful earthquakes in the past 60 years
Chile, Pacific Rim
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded on the Richter scale, magnitude 9.5, struck Valdivia, Chile.
In just ten minutes, the entire city of Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The tremor caused localised tsunamis that severely battered the Chilean coast, with waves up to 25 metres (82 ft).
Waves as high as 10.7 metres (35 ft) were recorded 10,000 kilometres (6,200 mi) from the epicenter, and as far away as Japan and the Philippines.
The death toll and monetary losses arising from this widespread disaster are not certain.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Alaska's Good Friday earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, and also Good Friday.
On that day, the largest earthquake in the history of North America occurred in Alaska, USA, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still the third largest earthquake in the world.
When the earthquake occurred, a fracture occurred in the layer between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate near College Fjord, Prince William Sound.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The displacement of the seabed caused a tsunami with a height of 67 meters.
Since it was a holiday, schools and many businesses were closed.
The quake ultimately claimed 139 lives.
Nine people died directly from the quake, while 130 others died from the tsunami it triggered.
The world's most destructive earthquakes in the past 60 years
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above occurred in Tangshan City and Pingnan County, Hebei Province, China, within 16 hours.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers deep.
The entire city of Tangshan was cut off from transportation, communication, water and electricity supply, and was leveled in an instant.
The capital Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to official statistics, 242,769 people died and 164,851 people were seriously injured in the disaster-stricken areas, including Beijing and Tianjin.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second deadliest earthquake in China's history, only second to the Jiajing earthquake in 1556.
However, some foreign scientists estimate that at least 650,000 people may have died in this earthquake.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Indian Ocean Earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred in the western coast of Aceh province, Sumatra, Indonesia, with a depth of 30 km and a moment magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a tsunami with wave heights of up to 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the most severely affected areas including Aceh province in Indonesia, Phuket tourist area in Thailand, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu in India.

At that time, it was the peak tourist season for Christmas, and the disaster-stricken areas gathered a large number of tourists and local residents, causing many tourists who were enjoying their vacation on the beach and local people who were working by the sea to be swept away by the tsunami, making many people missing in this earthquake.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people were killed and missing.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Sichuan earthquake, 2008
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, Sichuan Province, China.

According to the data from the China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake reached 8.2, and the moment magnitude reached 8.3, and the area of destruction exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.
Up to September 25, 2008, the earthquake caused 69,227 deaths, 17,923 missing, 374,643 injured, 19.93 million people lost their homes, and the total population affected was 4.6256 million.
It is the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China, and also the most serious casualties after the Tangshan earthquake.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day, and that efforts would be made to strengthen public education and attention to disaster prevention and reduction work.
Afterwards, many governments and primary and middle schools in China hold earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and middle schools also began to pay attention to popularizing "earthquake prevention and mitigation" education.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
2010 Haiti earthquake
On January 12, 2010, a 7.0-magnitude earthquake occurred in the sea and islands of Haiti in the Caribbean.
The epicenter of the earthquake was located 25 kilometers southwest of Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti, and the depth of the earthquake was about 13 kilometers.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
The Haitian government has confirmed more than 200,000 deaths.
In some areas of Haiti, up to 90% of the houses were destroyed by the earthquake.
Although the international community provided a large amount of aid and support, this overpopulated and corrupt poor country has never recovered from this disaster.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Tohoku earthquake and tsunami (2011)
On 11 March 2011, a magnitude 9.0 megathrust earthquake occurred off the coast of northeastern Japan.
The epicenter was in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, with a depth of 24 kilometers, and it triggered a tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters.
This earthquake was the first earthquake in Japan with a magnitude greater than 9 ever recorded.
Approximately 22,000 people died in the disaster, and approximately 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami, resulting in a leakage accident.
This accident was classified as the most serious level 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear disaster led to the detection of trace amounts of radioactive substances around the world, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (with a half-life of 30 years).
A large amount of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean.
According to the UN, at least 870,000 people in the disaster areas of the two countries are in urgent need of food.
In Syria alone, more than 5.3 million people have lost their homes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) has appealed for $77 million to provide food for people displaced by earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.
Temperatures in the disaster zone have dropped to below zero and many people are homeless.
The Turkish government has distributed large quantities of hot meals, tents and blankets, but many in desperate need are still not receiving aid.
In Syria, where a 12-year-old civil war has already made life unbearable for many, the earthquake has added to their misery.
In the four days since the earthquake, the World Food Programme has provided food aid to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) has sent 72 tonnes of medical supplies for wound care and emergency surgery.

NEWS GOV-MO: Alert: FHP urges public to beware of scam text messages impersonating telecommunications companies

Recently, the police received several cases of telecommunications fraud, in which the offenders posed as the local telecommunications company and sent fraudulent text messages containing website links to the victims, in order to lure the victims to log into the fake website to exchange points that were about to expire for rewards.

The victim entered their credit card information and verification code as instructed, and then received a notice from the financial institution that there were unauthorized transactions on their credit card, and they suspected that their credit card information had been stolen through the above website.
It was confirmed that the relevant telecommunications company did not send the above-mentioned text messages.

The police department calls on the public to be alert if they receive similar SMS messages, and not to log in to the website link in the SMS or provide any personal information; if they are asked to provide credit card information, account transaction password, transaction verification code, they should be more careful to prevent credit card theft.
Fraud prevention tips:
1. Pay more attention to network security information, and improve personal awareness of prevention;
2. Do not log in to unknown websites and register personal and credit card information on the website to prevent theft;
3. Be wary of fake websites and phishing websites, and always check whether the website address is exactly the same as the official website;
4. Install anti-virus software on your mobile phone, mobile device or computer, and update it regularly;
5. If you suspect you have been scammed or are a victim of a crime, call the Police Fraud Hotline 8800 7777 or the Crime Reporting Hotline 993 for assistance.

Singapore's tourism industry recovers strongly, with inbound tourists growing 19 times compared to 2021

(Compiled on 11th) The Singapore Tourism Board (STB) recently announced that it expects the number of international visitors to Singapore in 2023 to reach between 12 million and 14 million, which will bring in approximately S$1.8 billion to S$2.1 billion in tourism revenue; the number of visitors and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID
The Singapore tourism market is gradually restarting and recovering in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) show that the number of inbound tourists in 2022 increased by 19 times from 33.06 million in 2021 to 630 million, exceeding the STB's previous estimate of 40-60 million, and the number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore's tourism revenue was 89.6 billion yuan, and it is expected that the tourism revenue for the whole year of 2022 will reach 138-143 billion yuan, which is 6-7 times that of 2021 (18.9 billion yuan), and has already recovered to about 50%-52% of the level
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly S$50 million to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.

The Tourism Board recently announced that it plans to withdraw 1.1 billion Singapore dollars from this budget in the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to return.

In order to make health and wellness one of the highlights of Singapore tourism, the Singapore Tourism Board launched a consultation activity on November 23, 2022, planning to develop a health and wellness destination on the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Liling, Executive Director of the Sports and Wellness Tourism Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put physical health at the top of all considerations.

The development of a health and wellness destination in Marina South, which already has Gardens by the Bay and Marina Barrage, is expected to contribute to Singapore's tourism and economy, and keep visitors spending and staying longer in the city.
Chen Boon Leng, CEO of Singapore Tourism Board, said that health and wellness will become an important part of Singapore's tourism products in the next few years.
The COVID-19 pandemic has increased public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Board has been promoting health and wellness projects to local residents and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, offering more than 130 health and wellness activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences to visitors.

Besides the newly opened Singapore Children’s Museum, Gardens by the Bay’s Cloud Forest, Central Market at Esplanade, ArtScience Museum’s new “Explore the Unknown” gallery, and the outdoor amphitheater at Night Safari, the Tourism Board will support the development and updates of projects such as the Wildlife Reserves Singapore’s Jurong Bird Park to make Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate industry standards for meetings, exhibitions and incentive tourism for sustainable development within the year 2023, and focus on improving waste treatment and carbon emissions in two aspects, further optimizing the tourism environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry has accelerated the recovery of the aviation industry.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, Changi Airport passenger traffic has recovered strongly, with daily passengers reaching 150,000 and weekly passengers reaching 1 million, which is about 75% of pre-pandemic levels, and the number of airline employees has recovered to about 90% of pre-pandemic levels.

According to the data, Singapore received 23.6 million tourists from January to October 2022, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-pandemic level. The number of take-offs and landings was 170,000, which is 53% of the pre-pandemic level.
The tourism industry is recovering quickly, which has also driven the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, dining and shopping industries.
Singapore government and tourism industry have high expectations for the Chinese market.

Said Choo Suan Dian, Assistant Director of the International Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, a survey by a Chinese travel platform showed that Singapore's safety index ranks among the top three in the world, which is also one of the reasons why Chinese tourists love Singapore.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, about 3.6 million Chinese tourists visited Singapore for travel and leisure each year.
With China’s relaxation of border policies, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to 30% to 60% of 2019.
Ko Su Dan pointed out that in the future, the Tourism Board will closely monitor the further release of China's outbound travel policy signals to respond to the changes in tourist demand.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, Singapore Tourism Board will actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in response to new trends in outbound travel from China.

Looking forward to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is full of confidence. It believes that as long as the global economy does not show a significant downturn that affects public income and there are no new large-scale epidemics, the recovery of the tourism industry will be faster than expected.

Chongyang Q&A - How to View the US Non-Farm Employment Data in January, which is much higher than expected, and future trends - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Q: How does Reyong Investment view the US January non-farm payroll data, which far exceeded expectations, and future trends?

A: On February 3, the US Labor Department released the non-farm employment data for January 2023, with a net increase of 517,000 non-farm jobs, significantly higher than the market expectation of 189,000; the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; the hourly wage increased by 4.4% year-on-year and

From the total, this data has many one-time and technical factors that interfere, such as the adjustment of the behavior of survey and statistics, the update of seasonal factors, and the possible adjustment in the future (the non-agricultural employment increased from 504,000 to 364,000 in January 2022), and the non-agricultural employment is not as strong as the data shows.

From the structural point of view, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises is still there, but the proportion is relatively low; the new employment in high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels, education, health care, etc. has risen sharply, and the data shows that the labor force shortage in the service industry still exists.

Combined with the strong rebound of service industry PMI, job vacancies and labor shortage data, as well as the robust consumption credit data, we judge that the US service industry will experience a rapid recovery after extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tight supply and demand in the US labor market cannot be improved without a recession.

Currently, the U.S. labor market has more than 5 million supply gaps, and the labor force participation rate is rising slowly, especially the labor force participation rate of 25-54 years old is close to the pre-pandemic high.
In addition, due to the strong savings and consumption credit of American residents, the strong demand for consumption will further delay the impact of tightening policies on the labor market.
The continued tightness of the supply and demand in the US labor market will be the bottom line of the US economy in 2023.
With the interest rate hike almost coming to an end and the inflation expectation fluctuating, we are not optimistic about the continuous decline in wage growth.
Before the release of the data, the U.S. foreign exchange market was overly optimistic about the Federal Reserve's interest rate hike path.

With the continuous improvement of inflation data, the Federal Reserve has maintained the balance of keeping the market inflation expectations weak while shortening the interest rate hike steps, but the market has ignored the Fed's hawkish statements and not only expected the early cessation of interest rate hikes, but also expected two rate cuts at the end of the year.

In the context of tight labor market supply and demand and the uncertainty of the impact of tightening policies, we believe that the Fed's guidance on rate hikes at the end of the year is relatively reasonable, and the extreme expectations and trading congestion of the market may cause some damage to the market.

Despite this, the persistent slowdown in wage growth is only likely to underpin future inflation data as M2 year-on-year growth turns negative and various CPI components lead indicators to gradually improve, with U.S. CPI data having turned to a fast-falling phase since October, and the current market expectations are difficult to refute, and the market may enter a new round of bargaining after the next inflation data is released.

In 1996, Shanshan Stock (600884.SH) went public and became the first listed company in China's clothing industry.

Just when the clothing business was booming, Shanshan Group began to transform, because Zheng Yonggang realized that "once the market is opened up, Chinese brands will naturally form a ladder-type brand market, and the possibility of Shanshan suits always leading the trend is not great."

In 1999, Shengshi began to study the transformation of the enterprise, and Zheng Yonggang recalled at that time, "We came to Shanghai to find out what to do for transformation, and we found many experts and scholars, and we held many Zhuge Liang meetings and empty seminars.
Finally, we set two major strategic directions.

"Fund E-account" is coming: CSRC authorizes development, investors realize collection and inquiry of all funds under their names - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observer, Chen Jian, is it difficult to collect account information due to the complexity of the purchase channels of funds?
Do you always forget the "small bank"?
These problems of the masses will be solved soon.
On February 10, the CSRC announced that the "Fund E-account" app was available in various mobile app stores and was conducting a public trial run.

According to the introduction, "Fund E-Account" provides a "one-stop" query service for individual investors to inquire about public fund account and share information, aiming to solve the pain points of the industry service that the majority of small and medium investors forget their accounts and inquire about the cumbersome.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there are 156 public fund management companies in China, managing public fund assets of about 2.6 trillion yuan; there are 167 public fund registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
Each registration institution account system is independent, and there is no unified query channel in the industry.
Some industry insiders said that by the end of 2021, the number of investors in China's funds exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the population in the country invested in fund products.

Previously, investors had to inquire about their purchase situation through different sales channels, but through "Fund E-Account", they can inquire about the purchase situation of all sales channels and see their holdings at a glance.
What is the "Fund E-Account" App?

According to relevant documents, the "Fund E-Account" APP is a mobile application developed and constructed by China Clearing and Settlement with the approval of the CSRC for the public fund industry, which can provide investors with a one-stop query of the holding of public fund products outside the market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly learn about the holdings of their off-exchange shareholdings of various public fund products of fund management companies through all channels of sales in the market through the "Fund E-Account", and comprehensively improve the efficiency of inquiry.

Specifically, the information that investors can query through “Fund E-Account” includes: account information of funds opened by fund management companies of public funds in the entire market, account information of trading accounts opened by sales institutions of public funds, and the holding situation of the number of investors who are not subject to the 200-person limit for holding public fund investment funds and investment funds managed by securities companies, as well as the shareholding situation of other products such as

Liu Yiqian, the business manager of Shanghai Securities and Funds Evaluation Research Center, told the Economic Observer that investors can use the "Fund E-Account" App to obtain all their off-exchange public fund holdings in one step, helping them to recover "forgotten assets", and more importantly, the app has collected all the account information of the investors' comprehensive fund investment, helping them to better understand their investment situation, and thus optimize
How register for use?

The reporter noticed that the "Fund E-account" App has been listed in Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile application stores, but the App is still in the public trial operation stage, and registration requires filling in the invitation code, which can be obtained by investors through contacting the fund management company of the fund they hold.

A staff member of a large or medium-sized public fund management company in Shanghai provided a six-digit invitation code to the reporter of Economic Observer and said, "The APP is in the trial operation stage. China Settlement provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund management company, and investors can call to obtain them. We will provide them.
After the trial operation is over, users will be able to register without an invitation code.

The reporter registered an account and completed the inquiry according to the download and use instructions of the "Fund E-Account" related documents published on the website of the CSRC, and the entire process took only a few minutes, which was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real-name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund inquiry.

After completing the real-name authentication step, click the "Assets" button to bind the fund, and all fund products purchased by the reporter through various fund sales platforms will be displayed in the binding selection list (can be bound to the account), and after binding, the reporter can directly see the total assets of the fund and can start using the query function.
It is worth noting that the “Fund E-account” only provides investors with query services and cannot perform redemption and purchase.
The data displayed by "Fund E-Account" is generally three trading days before the date the user makes the inquiry (T day).

For example, when you open the "Fund E-account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and net asset value displayed on the asset page correspond to the previous three trading days, which is February 7.

French Labor Union Mobilizes Another Mass Rally Against Government Pension Reform

On Saturday (February 11), the French labor union launched a nationwide mobilization against the government's retirement reform bill, calling on the public to take to the streets to express their views.
This is the fourth day of social action against the government's pension system reform bill.
The number of people who respond to the call for the rally may affect the next action plan of the trade union group.

This is the fourth time in a month that the eight major French trade union groups have jointly launched a nationwide mobilization, and it is the first time that the demonstration has been scheduled for Saturday.

Since Saturday is a day off for most French people, they do not need to choose between participating in demonstrations and strikes, so the union groups hope that today's rally will attract more people to participate.

The unions of the public transport, subway and public railway companies did not call for a strike today, so the public transport system should work normally, and the citizens can take the bus to the rally site, and in the areas where the winter vacation starts, people can travel normally.
The unions hope to have more than one million people at the demonstrations, while police expect the national turnout to be between 600,000 and 800,000, with 90,000 to 120,000 in Paris.

Since the protest against the government's pension reform plan began, although polls show that most French people do not support the measure to delay the statutory retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who really go out and participate in the march has gradually decreased.
The first strike and demonstration on January 31st saw 1.27 million to 2.5 million people gather across the country.
The number of protesters on Monday (February 7) shrank to between 757,000 and 2 million people nationwide.
The pension reform is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
The opposition, especially the left-wing opposition groups, have submitted numerous amendments, which has slowed down the review process.
And the debate between the government and the opposition has become increasingly sharp and fierce.

A member of the French non-concessionist left-wing party, France Unbowed, recently posted a picture of himself stepping on a balloon with the head of the Minister of Labor on it on social media, which has caused the ruling party to protest.
The National Assembly Speaker finally announced a 15-day ban on the MP from participating in the activities of the National Assembly as a punishment for this behavior.

Although the reform plan has triggered the largest social movement in France in the past 20 years, the government has so far only made minor adjustments to the draft, but has not made any major concessions.
Unions are preparing to launch another strike next Thursday, March 7, when the reform bill is debated in the Senate, and plan to organize a demonstration.

Last East German Communist Leader Dies
Hans Modrow, the successor of the East German Communist Party, left us last night at the age of 95, the party reported in a statement.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall was opened, separating East and West Berlin for 28 years, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democracy.
At the time, Communist leaders were forced to resign as protesters demanding democracy and freedom took to the streets across East Germany.
Gorbachev, after coming to power in the Soviet Union, had also called for reforms in the Soviet-led East Europe.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results led to his resignation as chancellor.
Despite his reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and unification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reshape rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Modrow was convicted of electoral fraud in the municipal elections of May 1989, but did not go to prison.
The U.S. Justice Department denied the charges were politically motivated.
Modrow continued to serve in the German parliament until 1994 and was a member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Modrow saw himself as a reformer and wanted to change the communist party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want the old East Germany back, but that it should be recognized for its achievements.
Modrow was born in 1928 in the small German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland) and trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he was a leader of a youth fire brigade and later a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi paramilitary organization that recruited men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final battles of the war.
At 17, he was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union, where he took part in anti-fascist courses and became a staunch party member.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned home and found work as a mechanic while continuing his studies in social sciences and economics, earning a doctorate.

Modrow was a worker in the Free German Youth movement, which almost all East German young people joined, and from 1973 to 1989 he rose through the ranks of the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) to become chairman of the Dresden district.
He also served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, taking up the highest state office.

Iran's Islamic Republic held an official rally Saturday to mark the 44th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, but anti-government hackers briefly disrupted President Hassan Rouhani's televised speech.
The president's live TV speech was interrupted on the internet for about a minute, and a group of anti-government hackers' logo appeared on the screen, which was called "Edalat Ali (Ali's Justice)."
A voice was also heard shouting "Death to the Islamic Republic."
Reuters reported today that hackers interrupted state television coverage of the anniversary of the Iranian revolution.

Iran's hard-line government faced its biggest challenge yet from young protesters demanding they step down on the 44th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, but Rouhani still called on "deceived youth" to repent so they could be forgiven by Iran's supreme leader.
Mahsa Amini, 22, died in custody of Iran's morality police in September, sparking nationwide protests in Iran.
The crackdown by Iran's security forces on the protests is one of the biggest challenges faced by the Islamic Republic since the overthrow of the 2,500-year-old monarchy in the 1979 revolution.
As part of a pardon marking the anniversary of the revolution, Iranian authorities released hunger-striking dissident Farhad Meysami and Iranian-French scholar Fariba Adelkhah from prison on Friday.
Earlier, supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued a pardon that included some prisoners arrested in recent anti-government protests.
According to the human rights group HRANA, as of Friday, 528 protesters had been killed, including 71 minors.

This means “God is the greatest”.
However, many in the gathering could be heard shouting "Death to the dictator!"
"And the death of the Islamic Republic on social media."
On Saturday, state television broadcast live footage of official rallies in various provinces across the country.
In Tehran, as part of the official celebrations, Iranian-made anti-ballistic missiles, drones, anti-submarine cruisers and other military equipment were displayed.
President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's speech was repeatedly interrupted by chants of "Death to America," a slogan that has become a rallying cry at the state rallies.
The crowd also chanted "Death to Israel."

Adelkhah, who has been in prison since 2019, is one of seven French nationals held in Iran, a factor that has contributed to the deterioration in relations between Paris and Tehran in recent months, Reuters said.
She was sentenced to five years in prison in 2020 on national security charges.
They later put her under house arrest, but in January she was returned to prison.
Adelkhah has denied the allegations.
Meslamani was released a week earlier, with supporters warning he faced a risk of death due to hunger strike.
He was arrested in 2018 for protesting the compulsory wearing of the hijab.
The French Foreign Ministry called for Adelkhah's release on Friday, saying "she should be free to return to France if she wishes."
"We are relieved that she is free, but we are also very worried about her health.
Did the balloon incident brighten the eyes of the United States?
Strengthening restrictions on technology exports to China
According to the Wall Street Journal today, the United States is preparing to further tighten its export of technology to China after the balloon incident.

The incident highlights the national security threat posed by China and will garner more political support for the U.S. to strengthen its technological protection, said current and former security officials.
The United States said that the balloon carried antennas and sensors for information collection and communication.
Martijn Rasser, a former senior official at the CIA and now a fellow at the Center for a New American Security in Washington, said.
"That was without doubt pouring fuel on the fire and supporting the hard-line view on China," he said.

White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters on Thursday that "we will also consider taking additional actions to expose and address China's broader surveillance activities, which pose a threat to our national security and that of our allies and partners."
U.S. officials said they have notified more than 30 governments about the balloon incident, underscoring the importance of international coordination to address the Chinese threat.

Emily Benson, a senior fellow at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, said that beyond the Biden administration's actions, the newly formed House Select Committee on China, which is focused on the strategic competition between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party, could also put pressure on the United States to take more severe measures to slow down China's development.
She said members of Congress would feel increasing pressure to take a tougher stance, which could in turn force the White House to adopt tougher policies.

The Wall Street Journal said that many people who advocate stricter export controls are also promoting the expansion of the scope of controls, and include industries such as artificial intelligence in the scope.
The U.S. government is also working on a plan to review outbound investment for potential national security threats from China.
Analysts said the White House may face calls to speed up the plan.
The “921 Earthquake” Relief and Recovery Programme

Since the powerful quake hit Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have been working around the clock to dig through the rubble of thousands of destroyed buildings to find survivors buried under the debris.
In the freezing cold, they often call for silence, as they struggle to hear any sign of life amid the rubble of concrete.
Two women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake after surviving for several days, Reuters reported today.
But the death toll from the quake has risen to 24,150.
The death toll in Turkey stands at 20,665, while more than 3,500 have died in Syria.

The 7.8-magnitude quake that struck on Monday, followed by several strong aftershocks, is the seventh deadliest disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 Japan earthquake and tsunami and approaching the 2003 Bam earthquake in Iran, which killed 31,000 people.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000 people.

Two women were trapped for 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake in the region in 20 years, Turkish officials said Saturday, as rescuers pulled them from the rubble of collapsed buildings in Turkey.
Another injured man, 55-year-old Masallah Cicek, was pulled from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, Turkey's largest city in the southeast.
In the cold, rescuers often call for quiet, as they strain to hear any sign of life amid the rubble.
In Samandag, Turkey, rescuers huddled under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they carefully reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He opened his eyes, baby Yagiz Ulas was wrapped in a blanket and carried to a field hospital.
Video footage shows rescuers also carrying away his mother, who was dazed and pale on the stretcher, but conscious.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people have been pulled from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and 31,000 rescue workers have been mobilized in the disaster zone.
He said about 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals and 1.05 million were homeless and staying in temporary shelters.
With many people lacking food in the cold winter conditions, questions are growing over the leaders' response to the disaster.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, state media reported, in what was said to be his first visit to a quake-hit area since the disaster.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said its stocks in rebel-held northwestern Syria were running out as the war made aid work more complicated.
On Friday, Erdogan visited Adiyaman province in Turkey and admitted that the government's response had not been fast enough.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a vote on May 14, but may delay it because of the disaster.
Reuters said that the anger over the delay in providing aid and launching rescue operations could affect the election.
Even before the quake, the vote was seen as the toughest challenge to Erdogan's rule in two decades.
Erdogan called for unity and blamed what he called "negative campaigns" for political gain.
Turkey's main opposition leader Kemal Kilicdaroglu criticized the government's response.
"The earthquake was big, but what was worse than the earthquake was the lack of coordination, lack of planning and incompetence.

What is the "object" shot down in the sky of Alaska?
And what a twist(ed) ending!

The US military again used its most advanced stealth gas-spraying fighter jet F-22 on Friday afternoon (February 10) to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the sky of Alaska, the United States.
The object was shot down about 10 miles from the coast of Alaska.
This is the second time in less than a week that the US military has shot down an object flying in the air.
Last Saturday, a Chinese spy balloon that had been drifting in US airspace for several days was shot down over the coast of South Carolina.

The second object, which entered US airspace for the first time late Wednesday, was tracked by the US military as it moved through the skies above Alaska's northeast at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, and much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier, the Pentagon said.
The Pentagon also said that there was no indication that the object was controllable.

John Kirby, strategic communications coordinator for the White House National Security Council, said Friday that while the specifics of what was flying in the sky were not clear, it "poses a reasonable threat to civilian aviation."
Cobbs said the object was different from the one found over the United States because it did not have a payload hanging from it.
"We're calling it an 'object' because that's the best description we can give it at this time," Coppedge said.
President Biden took the advice of the Pentagon before ordering the object to be shot down, and he made the decision "very carefully," Cobbs added.
The official description of the object is that it is about the size of a small car, has no control stick, no payload, and is flying at about 10,000 feet.
But those details still don't answer basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to and what it's doing.
Many online analyses and speculation suggest that it could be another Chinese balloon.
It could be one of the Chinese balloons that have been invading American airspace and the one that was floating over Latin America, both of which are likely doing something.
Some people also associate the "object" in Alaska with "UFO" (Unidentified Flying Object).
The report quoted former U.S. Congressman Peter Meijer's tweet on Friday, saying, "I hope this UFO is a spy balloon and not a legitimate UFO."
"It's a bit of a joke to conflate alien spacecraft with weather balloons, but it's not worth starting an interstellar conflict over," Meijer said.
Meijer tweeted that out shortly after the object was shot down over Alaska.
Newsweek said that Meijer was not the only one who doubted that the object was a UFO.

Republican Rep. Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's handling of the information last month, calling on the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release a report on UFOs.

and then... fell into the pit.

As for the competition part, there is a little bit of bitterness about the changes of times and the old and new (maybe I am too sensitive).
I spent a lot of my high school study time reading this book, but I couldn't put it down.

The full-time description of characters and emotions is very impressive, some characters only appear occasionally, but they will leave a deep impression on the reader, such as the characters that are described in more detail, like Lei Xiu, Huang Shao Dan, Tian Suo, and Mou Gui, who all have a lot of fans, while characters who are not the focus of the story, such as Jiang Bo, Tao Wu, and Xiu Chun,

And in terms of romance, there is no after-palace-harem-of-three-million-beauties-or-rotten-women-type of problem that is so often criticized in general web novels, all the characters' feelings in the entire book have a common ground, which is that they all like the game of honor and want to win in an upright manner.
There are no big plots, and everyone is so simple and cute.
This may be why there are no characters in the full-time job that are disliked.
The IP of Full-time is also very large, and this is also due to this.
Leaving aside the phenomenon of web novels, Full-Time is a good book.
He does give you a little bit of blood and a little bit of emotion.
This April, Full-Time will be serialized as a manga.

I read it a long time ago, and by chance I saw some reviews written by memory, so I wrote my feelings after reading.
This book is not so much a collection of short stories as it is a collection of fragments of love in life.
The tone of the book is extremely flat, like plain water, the pursuit of simplicity in expression and sentence construction is extreme, and the plot is as quiet and flat as a summer afternoon street.
Each short story is a clip of a small part of ordinary life, without a beginning or an end.
Collected together, they are named "What We Talk About When We Talk About Love".
我想,這本小說集,以及它的標題,像是一種行為藝術,作者想表達的是,愛情不止是舞臺上的悲歡離合,都市傳說中的海枯石爛,也不只是你儂我儂的如膠似漆,愛情不止是以上
When you read this book, your mind may recall the quarrels of the couple next to you, the dull marriages of the people you know, and the unsuccessful love.

This is the reason why I do not recommend reading it. From the perspective of reviewing, the writing style and the plot of this book are tasteless. Unless your life is full of ups and downs or as sweet as living in a candy castle, you will feel that it is neither strange nor interesting when reading it.

And from a depth of thought, the daily events do not illuminate or expand a person's thinking and vision (different from Marquez's "Love in the Time of Cholera"), and the short fragments do not discuss any problems, such as what kind of mistakes led to the failure of love?
What are the reasons for the protagonist's marital breakdown?
So I don't recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not, it doesn't matter much.
The author's ideas are more expressed through techniques and style rather than the story plot, which is also the reason why the reading experience of this book is not very good.
It is suitable for coarse reading, but not for careful reading.
The logic of the book is good, but the content is not enough.
It explains a lot of sales theories, what and why, but is weak on how to do it, just points the way but doesn't give specifics.
Also, the book feels like it was put together.
Examples are given from both inside and outside the country; from well-known entrepreneurs and salesmen to those who are not well-known.
I don't know if it's because of the examples that the stories are compiled, if some examples that the author has experienced are more convincing.
The term customer is used interchangeably with client.
The title still says customer, but the text changes to customer.
There are also typos, missing punctuation, and numbering errors in the e-book.
In summary, this book is a good choice for a theoretical introduction, but it is not suitable for people who want to improve their sales level and have already been engaged in sales work.
A quick guide to internet finance

This book is very shallow, can be said to be only a beginning of the course, can help everyone quickly understand the full picture of Internet finance, but to understand in depth, still need to follow the picture to dig.
The book was written earlier, and the later battle of Alipay and WeChat for user habits supplementation was not mentioned, so the share of third-party payment may not be as small as the book said.
Nowadays, many people go out to eat and only need to bring their phones, and merchants also abandoned UnionPay because of high bank turnover.

But I am very grateful to the author for writing this introductory book. It can be seen that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the history of financial development in the country and abroad, so he can write such popular and easy-to-understand content.
It is easy to write high-level and abstract, but it is difficult to write in a simple and understandable way.

According to Maslow’s hierarchy of needs, after people’s basic survival needs are met, the most urgent thing is to meet their psychological needs - to be understood, affirmed and recognized.
Indeed, for the Chinese, most of them are "love you in the heart", even if they have love, gratitude and praise, they will keep it in their heart and will not say it out loud.
In this book, the author expounds five ways of affirmation: words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, thoughtful gifts, and physical touch.

I think it is not important for you to know what the five languages of appreciation are, but it is important for you to use these five languages to appreciate and thank the people around you, whether they are family members, friends or colleagues.
In fact, the closer the relationship, the more we need to be appreciated and thanked, so that our lives will be more beautiful.
Learn to praise, enterprises can also retain talents to a certain extent, reduce turnover rate.
We would like to give thanks to the translator for bringing us the wonderful ideas and world from abroad.
Due to the background of Chinese and Western culture, there may be some differences between languages. If there is an opportunity to see the original version of the author, it will be more rewarding.
Thank you authors, translators and editors for your hard work!

The worst shopping experience in history

In the evening of September 23, my wife dropped her phone, and I was suddenly inspired to order a 8p from Amazon Malaysia. It was in stock, but not self-operated and without any additional fees (I was secretly happy), because it was not self-operated, the delivery was slower, and the system showed that the latest expected delivery date was September 27.

My wife couldn’t use her phone, so she was suffering. The next morning, she called me at 6:30 and asked me to think of a solution. After looking at Jingdong, I found that the 256G version was in stock and could be delivered the same day, so I had to order another one immediately.
I bought a new one, and I wanted to cancel the order from Amazon right away.

Because the order was placed at night, it was impossible to receive the express delivery in the middle of the night, so at 7:30 in the morning, I called the customer service to request the cancellation of the order, and the customer service replied that the order had been canceled and was waiting for the SMS notification.

OK, I will wait patiently. In the afternoon, I took out my phone and found that the order was still in the status of not shipped. I immediately contacted the customer service to request the cancellation of the order, and the customer service replied that the operation was OK.

In the afternoon, I looked at my phone and found that the order was still there. I couldn't help but contact the customer service again to confirm that I had called three times and asked them to cancel the order and notify the seller not to ship!
The customer service contacted the seller on my request and told me that the seller was not familiar with the system and would cancel the order after getting familiar with the system.
But they told me the seller knew and would definitely not ship it, so I could relax.
When I checked the order on Monday, I found that it had been shipped, and I was speechless.
Since I could not contact the seller directly, I had to call customer service again.
The aftermath is beyond words, basically I say one thing, and the customer service does the next step.
The order is still in the status of delivery refusal, and is preparing to be sent again!
Amazon should have followed up, shouldn't they?
The seller company has received the money, so it doesn't matter if they don't follow up.
In summary, I will never pay for large items in advance again, this is too troublesome.
